intro: Litsea membranifolia, commonly known as the paperleaf litsea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions of China, India, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thin, papery leaves that are often aromatic, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Litsea membranifolia typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
